lines.text: You're tearing me apart!

I woke up this morning, you know... and the sun was shining, and it was nice, and all that type of stuff. And the first thing, I saw you, and, uh, I said, "Boy, this is gonna be one terrific day, so you better live it up, because tomorrow you'll be nothing." You see? And I almost was.
You know something? I like you.
Why do we do this?
You've gotta do something. Don't you?
Nobody talks to children.
No, they just tell them.
I don't know what to do anymore. Except maybe die.
You can wake up now, the universe has ended.
I love somebody. All the time I've been... I've been looking for someone to love me. And now I love somebody. And it's so easy. Why is it easy now?
I don't know; it is for me, too.
I love you, Jim. I really mean it.
Well, I'm glad.
Do you think the end of the world will come at nighttime?
Uh-uh, at dawn.
[Looking up at stars in a planetarium]
Once you been up there you know you've been someplace.

[sitting down, hugging his father's legs helplessly]
Help me!

Look, Jim. You can depend on me. Trust me. Whatever comes, we'll, we'll fix it together. I swear it. Now Jim, stand up. I'll stand up with you. I'll try and be as strong as you want me to be. Come on.

We give you love and affection, don't we? Well, then, what is it? Was it because we went to that party? Well, you know what kind of drunken brawls those kind of parties turn into. It's not a place for kids.
A minute ago, you said you didn't care if he drinks.
He said a little drink.
You're tearing me apart!

[shocked]
What?
You, you say one thing, he says another, and everybody changes back again!
That's a fine way to behave!
Well, you know who he takes after.
You know something? You read too many comic books.
I've got the bullets!
You'll learn. When you're older, Jim.
Well, I don't think that I want to learn that way.
Well, it doesn't matter anyway, because we're moving.

[Grabs his mother]
You're not going to tear me loose again.
Well, this is news to me! Just why are we moving?
Oh, do I have to spell it out.
You are not going to use me as an excuse again!
I don't.
Everytime you can't face yourself, you blame it on me!
That is not true!

You say it's because of me, you say it's because of the neighborhood! You use every other phony excuse! Mom, I just... Once I want to do something right! And I don't want you to run away from me again! Dad.
This is all going too fast for me, son.
You better give me something. You better give me something fast.
Jimmy, you're very young. A foolish decision now could wreck you're whole life. In ten years, you'll never know this happened.
Dad, answer her. Tell her. Ten years. Dad, let me hear you answer her. Dad.
[Mr. Stark sits quietly]
Dad, stand up for me.
[Mr. Stark still sits quietly, he grabs his father and yanks him up]
Stand up!
Oh he's real abstract. He's hm, he's different.
That's right. That's right. I'm cute too.
I don't want any trouble.
If I had one day when I didn't have to be all confused and I didn't have to feel that I was ashamed of everything. If I felt that I belonged someplace. You know?

[to Ray]
Please, lock me up. I'm gonna hit somebody and I don't want to...
Do you go by another name?
They call me Plato.
He was a Greek philosopher. They
[Plato turns away]
You talk nice to the man, John, he's going to help you.
Nobody can help me.

[to a shivering Plato]
Want my jacket?
[Plato looks up at Jim]
You want my jacket? It's warm.
[Plato shakes his head]
You ever been in a chickie-run?
Yeah, that's all I ever do.
[Buzz leaves]
Plato, what's a chickie-run?
Is this where you live?
Who lives?
Hey they forgot to wind the sundial.
I'll bet you'd go to a hanging.
I guess it's just my morbid personality.
If only you coulda been my dad. We could have breakfast in the morning.

[walks down the stairs and into the empty pool]
Oh, a sunken nursery!
You're shivering, John. Are you cold?

[Gets up from his seat and takes his jacket off]
You want my jacket?
Turn out the light!
I didn't chicken. You saw where I jumped. What did I have to do, kill myself?
Hello, Jamie.
Jamie?
I don't think I want anything, I'm nervous.
My first day of school, I was so nervous, Mother made me eat so much, I couldn't swallow until recess.
Did you make my sandwiches?
There's meatloaf and, peanut butter.
[Jim laughs]
What did I tell you?
[condescendingly]
Peanut butter.
Well there's a thermos of orange juice and apple sauce cake to go with it.

[to Jim]
And *I* made that.
Now, would you like to rent or are you more in the mood to buy, dear?
You decide, darling. Remember, our budget.
Oh, don't give it a second thought, it's, uh, only 3 million dollars a month.
What?
Oh, we can afford it. I'll scrimp and I'll save and I'll work my fingers to the bone. You see, we're newlyweds... oh, there's just one more thing... what about...
Children?
Yes.
Right this way, mind you, though, we don't encourage them. They're such a bother.
Oh I quite agree, I just can't stand it when they cry. What do you do with them when they cry?

[Magoo voice]
Drown 'em like puppies, ha!
I used to lay awake in my crib at night and listen to them fight.
Can you really remember back that far? I can't even remember what happened yesterday.
[first lines]
Get up, get up. Mixed up in that beating on 12th street, huh?
No. Plain drunkenness.
Get lost!
Hang loose, boy. I'm warning you!
Wash up and go home!
If he had guts to knock Mom cold once, then maybe she'd be happy and then she'd stop picking on him. Because they make mush out of him! Just mush!
I wouldn't make a hasty decision. Nobody can make a snap decision. We've got to consider the pros and cons, make a list, get advice... Have I ever stopped you from doing anything?
Why did you shoot those puppies, John?
What's that?
That's a new disease.
What does he know about man alone?
[last lines]
Mom. Dad. This is Judy. She's my friend.
He's...
[Frank speaks, overlapping so their words become unintelligible]
You know if the boy ever talked to a psychiatrist?
You mean a head-shrinker?
Oh, Mrs. Crawford don't believe in them, sir.
Well, maybe she better start.

[referring to his parents]
They think I can make friends if we move. Just move, everything will be roses and sunshine.
What are you Hanging-around such rank company for?
